Identification.LongTitle: Nuclear Substances and Radiation Devices Regulations

Provision.Text: Her Excellency the Governor General in Council, on the recommendation of the Minister of Natural Resources, pursuant to section 44 of the Nuclear Safety and Control Acta, hereby approves the annexed Nuclear Substances and Radiation Devices Regulations made by the Canadian Nuclear Safety Commission on May 31, 2000.

Section.Text: The definitions in this section apply in these Regulations.

Definition.Text: Act means the Nuclear Safety and Control Act. (Loi)
bulk quantity means, in respect of the terms exemption quantity and unconditional clearance level,

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: when referred to in section 5, a quantity of material greater than one tonne; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: when referred to in section 5.1, a quantity of material greater than one tonne per year per nuclear facility. (quantité en vrac)

Definition.Text: certificate means a document issued by the Commission or by a designated officer authorized under paragraph 37(2)(a) or (b) of the Act, indicating that prescribed equipment or a person is certified. (attestation ou homologation)
certified means certified by the Commission under paragraph 21(1)(h) or (i) of the Act or by a designated officer authorized under paragraph 37(2)(a) or (b) of the Act. (homologué)
Class II prescribed equipment has the meaning assigned to that term by section 1 of the Class II Nuclear Facilities and Prescribed Equipment Regulations. (équipement réglementé de catégorie II)
conditional clearance level means an activity concentration that does not result in an effective dose

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: greater than 1 mSv in a year due to a low probability event referred to in the IAEA Safety Standard RS-G-1.7; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: greater than 10 µSv in a year. (niveau de libération conditionnelle)

Definition.Text: depleted uranium means uranium that contains uranium 235 in a concentration that is less than that normally found in nature. (uranium appauvri)
dosimeter means a device for measuring a dose of radiation that is worn or carried by an individual. (dosimètre)
effective dose has the meaning assigned to that term by subsection 1(1) of the Radiation Protection Regulations. (dose efficace)
exemption quantity means any of the following:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a radioactive nuclear substance set out in column 1 of Schedule 1,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if the radioactive nuclear substance is uniformly distributed in material and not in bulk quantity, the corresponding activity concentration set out in column 2, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the corresponding activity set out in column 3;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a radioactive nuclear substance that is not set out in column 1 of Schedule 1,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if the atomic number of the substance is equal to or less than 81,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: 10 Bq/g if the radioactive nuclear substance is uniformly distributed in material and not in bulk quantity, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the atomic number of the substance is greater than 81 and the substance, or its short-lived radioactive progeny, does not emit alpha radiation,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: 10 Bq/g if the radioactive nuclear substance is uniformly distributed in material and not in bulk quantity, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: if the atomic number of the substance is greater than 81 and the substance, or its short-lived radioactive progeny, emits alpha radiation,

Clause.Label: (A)
Clause.Text: 1 Bq/g if the radioactive nuclear substance is uniformly distributed in material and not in bulk quantity, or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of more than one radioactive nuclear substance,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: if the radioactive nuclear substances are uniformly distributed in material and not in bulk quantity, the quotient obtained by dividing the total activity concentration by the sum of quotients obtained by dividing the activity concentration of each radioactive nuclear substance by its corresponding exemption quantity as referred to in paragraph (a) or (b), or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the quotient obtained by dividing the total activity by the corresponding sum of quotients obtained by dividing the activity of each radioactive nuclear substance by its corresponding exemption quantity as referred to in paragraph (a) or (b). (quantité d’exemption)

Definition.Text: exposure device means a radiation device that is designed for carrying out gamma radiography, and includes any accessory to the device such as a sealed source assembly, a drive mechanism, a sealed source assembly guide tube and an exposure head. (appareil d’exposition)

IAEA Safety Standard RS-G-1.7 means the IAEA Safety Standards, Safety Guide No. RS-G-1.7 — Application of the Concepts of Exclusion, Exemption and Clearance, 2004 Edition published by the International Atomic Energy Agency. (Norme de sûreté RS-G-1.7 de l’AIEA)

licensed activity means an activity described in any of paragraphs 26(a) to (c) of the Act that a licence authorizes the licensee to carry on in relation to a nuclear substance or a radiation device. (activité autorisée)
licensee means a person who is licensed to carry on an activity described in any of paragraphs 26(a) to (c) of the Act in relation to a nuclear substance or a radiation device. (titulaire de permis)
natural uranium means uranium that contains uranium 235 in a concentration that is normally found in nature. (uranium naturel)
nuclear criticality means a self-sustaining chain reaction of nuclear fission. (criticité nucléaire)

operate includes, in respect of an exposure device, coupling the drive mechanism to the exposure device, uncoupling the drive mechanism from the exposure device, locking or unlocking the exposure device, and all activities involving the device that take place while the sealed source assembly is not locked inside the device in the fully shielded position. (faire fonctionner)
prescribed equipment means the equipment prescribed by section 20 of the General Nuclear Safety and Control Regulations. (équipement réglementé)
radiation device means

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a device that contains more than the exemption quantity of a nuclear substance and that enables the nuclear substance to be used for its radiation properties; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a device that contains a radium luminous compound. (appareil à rayonnement)

Definition.Text: radiation survey meter means an instrument that is capable of measuring radiation dose rates. (radiamètre)

sealed source means a radioactive nuclear substance in a sealed capsule or in a cover to which the substance is bonded, where the capsule or cover is strong enough to prevent contact with or the dispersion of the substance under the conditions for which the capsule or cover is designed. (source scellée)

sealed source assembly means a sealed source that is designed to be used in an exposure device, and includes the components that are permanently attached to the sealed source. (assemblage de source scellée)
servicing in respect of radiation devices, means any maintenance of a device, including installation, repair, or dismantling, other than maintenance that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: constitutes routine operating procedures as indicated in the manufacturer’s operating manual for the device; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: is authorized in the licence issued in respect of the possession or use of the device. (entretien)

Definition.Text: specific activity means the activity per unit mass. (activité spécifique)

unconditional clearance level, in respect of a bulk quantity of material, except for surface contaminated material, in which the radioactive nuclear substance is uniformly distributed, means an activity concentration that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a radioactive nuclear substance set out in column 1 of Schedule 2, is the corresponding activity concentration set out in column 2;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of a radioactive nuclear substance that is not set out in column 1,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is 1 Bq/g, if the atomic number of the substance is equal to or less than 81,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is 1 Bq/g, if the atomic number of the substance is greater than 81 and the substance, or its short-lived radioactive progeny, does not emit alpha radiation, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: is 0.1 Bq/g, if the atomic number of the substance is greater than 81 and the substance, or its short-lived radioactive progeny, emits alpha radiation; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: in respect of more than one radioactive nuclear substance — except for Thorium 232, Uranium 235, Uranium 238 and their radioactive progeny mentioned in paragraph 4.3 of the IAEA Safety Standard RS-G-1.7 — is the quotient obtained by dividing the total activity concentration by the sum of quotients obtained by dividing the activity concentration of each radioactive nuclear substance by its corresponding activity concentration as referred to in paragraph (a) or (b). (niveau de libération inconditionnelle)

Definition.Text: unsealed source means a source other than a sealed source. (source non scellée)
worker means a person who performs work that is referred to in a licence. (travailleur)

Subsection.Text: These Regulations apply to all nuclear substances and sealed sources, as well as to all radiation devices that are not included in Class II prescribed equipment.
These Regulations do not apply in respect of the packaging or transport of nuclear substances, sealed sources or radiation devices.

An application for a licence in respect of a nuclear substance or a radiation device, other than a licence to service a radiation device, shall contain the following information in addition to the information required by section 3 of the General Nuclear Safety and Control Regulations:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the methods, procedures and equipment that will be used to carry on the activity to be licensed;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the methods, procedures and equipment that will be used while carrying on the activity to be licensed, or during and following an accident, to

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: monitor the release of any radioactive nuclear substance from the site of the activity to be licensed,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: detect the presence of and record the radiation dose rate and quantity in becquerels of radioactive nuclear substances at the site of the activity to be licensed,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: limit the spread of radioactive contamination within and from the site of the activity to be licensed, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: decontaminate any person, site or equipment contaminated as a result of the activity to be licensed;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the circumstances in which the decontamination referred to in subparagraph (b)(iv) will be carried out;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed location of the activity to be licensed, including a description of the site;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the roles, responsibilities, duties, qualifications and experience of workers;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed training program for workers;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed instructions for dealing with accidents, including fires and spills, in which the nuclear substance may be involved;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed inspection program for the equipment and systems that will be used to carry on the activity to be licensed;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the methods, procedures and equipment that will be used to calibrate radiation survey meters in accordance with these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: the methods, procedures and equipment that will be used to calibrate and verify the calibration of dosimeters referred to in paragraphs 30(3)(d) and (e);

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: the methods, procedures and equipment that will be used to conduct the leak tests and surveys required by these Regulations;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: where the application is in respect of a nuclear substance that is an unsealed source and that is to be used in a room, the proposed design of the room;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: if the application is in respect of a nuclear substance that is contained in a radiation device, the brand name and model number of the radiation device, and the quantity of the devices;

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: where the application is in respect of Category I, II or III nuclear material, as defined in section 1 of the Nuclear Security Regulations,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the measures that will be taken to prevent nuclear criticality, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the information required by section 3 or 4 of the Nuclear Security Regulations, as applicable;

Paragraph.Label: (o)
Paragraph.Text: if the applicant will be manufacturing or distributing radiation devices referred to in paragraph 5(1)(c) or section 6 or 7, or check sources mentioned in section 8.1, the proposed procedure for the disposal of each radiation device or check source or for its return to the manufacturer.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of an application for a licence to import or export for which the information requirements are prescribed by the Nuclear Non-proliferation Import and Export Control Regulations.

Section.Text: An application for a licence to service a radiation device shall contain the following information in addition to the information required by section 3 of the General Nuclear Safety and Control Regulations:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the brand name and model number of the device or the number of the certificate relating to the device;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the nature of the servicing proposed to be carried on;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed methods, procedures and equipment for carrying on the servicing;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed qualification requirements and training program for workers; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the proposed procedures to be followed after completion of the servicing to confirm that the device is safe to use.

Subsection.Text: A person may carry on any of the following activities without a licence:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: possess, transfer, import, export, use, mine, produce, refine, convert, enrich, process, reprocess, manage or store a radioactive nuclear substance if the activity or the activity concentration of the substance does not, at any one time, exceed

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: its exemption quantity,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: its conditional clearance level, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: its unconditional clearance level;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: possess, transfer, import, export, store, use, abandon, produce or service a sealed source that contains less than the exemption quantity of a radioactive nuclear substance;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: possess, transfer, import, export, store, use or abandon a radiation device, other than an exposure device, if the quantity of the nuclear substance or substances contained in the device is less than 10 times the exemption quantity;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: possess, transfer, store, use, abandon, produce, refine, convert, enrich, process, reprocess, manage or dispose of deuterium or a compound containing deuterium, if the quantity of deuterium is less than 10 kg in any calendar year;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: possess, transfer, store, use or manage depleted uranium, in any quantity, that is used as counterweights in aircraft if

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: each counterweight manufactured after the coming into force of this subparagraph is durably and legibly impressed with the words “DEPLETED URANIUM APPAUVRI” and the words are visible through any plating or other covering,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: each counterweight manufactured after the coming into force of this subparagraph is durably and legibly labelled or impressed with the name of the manufacturer and its unique identification number and the statement “UNAUTHORIZED ALTERATIONS PROHIBITED / MODIFICATIONS INTERDITES SANS AUTORISATION”,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii.1)
Subparagraph.Text: no alteration is made to the counterweights except in accordance with the requirements set out in subsection 571.02(1) of the Canadian Aviation Regulations, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: no chemical, physical or metallurgical treatment or processing of the counterweights is done other than for the repair or restoration of any plating or other covering; or

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: possess, transfer, use or abandon material that contains not more than 10 kg of depleted uranium, natural uranium or natural thorium in any calendar year and that is not used for its radiation properties.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of Category I, II or III nuclear material, as defined in section 1 of the Nuclear Security Regulations.

Paragraphs (1)(a) to (c) do not apply in respect of the import or export of a nuclear substance, sealed source or radiation device to which the Nuclear Non-proliferation Import and Export Control Regulations apply.
A person may, without a licence, abandon or dispose of a radioactive nuclear substance if the activity or the activity concentration of the substance does not exceed

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: its exemption quantity;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: its conditional clearance level; or

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: its unconditional clearance level.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: Category I nuclear material, Category II nuclear material or Category III nuclear material, as those terms are defined in section 1 of the Nuclear Security Regulations; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: discharges of effluents from

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: Class I nuclear facilities, as defined in section 1 of the Class I Nuclear Facilities Regulations, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: mines or mills, as those terms are defined in section 1 of the Uranium Mines and Mills Regulations.

Section.Text: A person may, without a licence to carry on that activity, possess, transfer, use or abandon a smoke detector that contains a nuclear substance, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the smoke detector does not contain more than 185 kBq of americium 241 or, where it is in a commercial or industrial facility, more than 740 kBq of americium 241;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the radiation dose rate does not exceed 1 µSv per hour at 0.1 m from any of the accessible surfaces of the smoke detector;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the design and construction of the smoke detector prevent persons from making direct contact with the nuclear substance that it contains under normal conditions of use;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: all markings and labels on the smoke detector are legible;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the radioactive nuclear substance contained in the smoke detector is a sealed source that, when it is mounted in its holder, conforms to International Standard 2919, Radiation Protection — Sealed radioactive sources — General requirements and classification (1999), of the International Organization for Standardization; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the smoke detector meets the tests specified in the annex entitled Prototype Tests of the Recommendations for ionization chamber smoke detectors in implementation of radiation protection standards (1977) of the Nuclear Energy Agency of the Organisation for Economic Co-operation and Development.

Section.Text: A person may, without a licence to carry on that activity, possess, transfer, use or abandon a tritium-activated self-luminous safety sign if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the only nuclear substance contained in the safety sign is tritium;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the safety sign contains no more than 925 GBq of tritium in gaseous form;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the light-emitting component containing the tritium consists of glass tubes that are enclosed in a sturdy metal or plastic frame mounted in a manner that prevents the dismantlement and removal of the glass tubes;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the amount of tritium present in the form of oxide does not exceed 1 per cent per volume for each glass tube;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the safety sign conforms to ANSI/HPS N43.4-2000, Classification of Radioactive Self-Luminous Light Sources, of the American National Standards Institute/Health Physics Society, or to Standard MIL-STD-810F, 2000, Department of Defense Test Method Standard for Environmental Engineering Considerations and Laboratory Tests, of the United States Department of Defense; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the safety sign, if it is manufactured after the coming into force of this paragraph, is marked with the name and quantity in becquerels of the nuclear substance, the manufacturer’s recommended expiry date for the sign and the date of manufacture of the sign.

Section.Text: A person may, without a licence to carry on that activity, possess, transfer or use a device that contains a nuclear substance, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the only nuclear substance contained in the device is a radium luminous compound;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the person does not possess more than 10 such devices; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the device is not disassembled or tampered with.

Section.Text: A person may, without a licence to carry on that activity, possess, transfer, store, use or abandon a check source that contains a radioactive nuclear substance and that is designed to verify the response of an instrument when exposed to the radiation output of the check source, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the check source contains

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than 370 kBq of a nuclear substance and the substance, or its short-lived radioactive progeny, does not emit alpha radiation, or

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: not more than 3.7 kBq of a nuclear substance if the atomic number of the substance is greater than 81 and the substance, or its short-lived radioactive progeny, emits alpha radiation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the radiation dose rate does not exceed 1 µSv per hour at 0.1 m from any of the accessible surfaces of the check source;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the design and construction of the check source, under normal conditions of use, prevent persons from making direct contact with the nuclear substance that it contains;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: all markings and labels on the check source or exterior packaging are legible;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the radioactive nuclear substance in the check source, when it is mounted in its holder, conforms to International Standard 2919, Radiation Protection — Sealed radioactive sources — General requirements and classification (1999), of the International Organization for Standardization; and

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the check source, if it is a sealed source, meets the tests specified in ANSI/HPS N43.6-1997, Sealed Radioactive Sources — Classification, of the American National Standards Institute/Health Physics Society.

Section.Text: Sections 6 to 8.1 do not apply to manufacturers or initial distributors in Canada of the devices or check sources referred to in those sections.

Subsection.Text: No person shall use a radiation device unless

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: it is a certified model; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: it is used in accordance with a licence that authorizes its use for development purposes.

Subsection.Text: No person shall transfer a radiation device for use within Canada unless it is a certified model.
The Commission or a designated officer authorized under paragraph 37(2)(a) of the Act may certify a model of a radiation device after receiving an application that includes the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the applicant’s name and business address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name and business address of the manufacturer of the device;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the brand name and model number of the device;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the design of the device and its components, including any standards used in the design;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the intended use of the device;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the name, quantity in becquerels and form of the nuclear substance to be incorporated into the device;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the method of incorporating the nuclear substance into the device;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the expected radiation dose rates around the device in all modes of operation, including the method, calculations and measurements used to establish them;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: instructions for the use, transportation and storage of the device;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: instructions for conducting leak tests on the device;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: instructions for dealing with accidents, including fires and spills, in which the device may be involved;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the labelling of the device;

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: the quality assurance program that was followed during the design of the device and that will be followed during production of the device; and

Paragraph.Label: (n)
Paragraph.Text: the recommended inspection and servicing program for the device.

Subsection.Text: The Commission or the designated officer may request any other information that is necessary to enable the Commission or the designated officer to determine whether the model of the device poses an unreasonable risk to the environment, the health and safety of persons or national security and whether certification of the model of the device would be in conformity with measures of control and international obligations to which Canada has agreed.

The Commission or a designated officer authorized under paragraph 37(2)(a) of the Act shall notify a person who has applied for the certification of a model of a radiation device of a proposed decision not to certify the model, as well as the basis for the proposed decision, at least 30 days before refusing to certify it.
The notice shall include a description of the person’s right to be provided with an opportunity to be heard in accordance with the procedure referred to in section 15.

The Commission or a designated officer authorized under paragraph 37(2)(a) of the Act shall notify a person to whom a certificate for a model of a radiation device has been issued, and any licensee who is licensed in respect of that model, of a proposed decision to decertify the model, as well as the basis for the proposed decision, at least 30 days before decertifying it.
The notice shall include a description of the person’s and the licensee’s right to be provided with an opportunity to be heard in accordance with the procedure referred to in section 15.

Where a person referred to in section 13 or 14 or a licensee referred to in section 14 has received a notice and has requested, within 30 days after the date of receipt of the notice, an opportunity to be heard either orally or in writing, the person or the licensee shall be provided with such an opportunity in accordance with the request.

On completion of a hearing held in accordance with subsection (1), every person and licensee who was notified in accordance with section 13 or 14 shall be notified of the decision and the reasons for it.

Where neither a person referred to in section 13 or 14 nor a licensee referred to in section 14 requests an opportunity to be heard within the period referred to in subsection (1), they shall be notified of the decision and the reasons for it.

Section.Text: No licensee shall use a radioactive nuclear substance or a radiation device on a person except as directed by a medical practitioner who is qualified to give such direction under the applicable provincial legislation.

Every licensee shall make available to all workers, at the site of the licensed activity, copies of any instructions referred to in the licence concerning radiation safety and accidents, including fires and spills, in which a nuclear substance may be involved.

Subsection.Text: Every licensee who possesses, uses or produces either a sealed source containing 50 MBq or more of a nuclear substance or a nuclear substance as shielding shall, at the following times, conduct leak tests on the sealed source or shielding using instruments and procedures that enable the licensee to detect a leakage of 200 Bq or less of the nuclear substance:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: where the sealed source or shielding is used after being stored for 12 or more consecutive months, immediately before using it;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: where the sealed source or shielding is being stored, every 24 months;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: where an event that may have damaged the sealed source or shielding has occurred, immediately after the event; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: in all other cases,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: where the sealed source or shielding is located in a radiation device, every 12 months, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: where the sealed source or shielding is not located in a radiation device, every six months.

Subsection.Text: Subsection (1) does not apply in respect of a sealed source that is

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: gaseous;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: contained in a static eliminator that has been retained by the licensee for less than 15 months;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: exempted under section 5, 6, 8 or 8.1; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: used or stored underwater in a nuclear facility that is equipped with a device capable of detecting water-borne contamination of 200 Bq or less of a nuclear substance.

Subsection.Text: Where a licensee, in the course of conducting a leak test on a sealed source or on shielding, detects the leakage of 200 Bq or more of a nuclear substance, the licensee shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: discontinue using the sealed source or shielding;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: discontinue using the radiation device in which the sealed source or shielding is located or may have been located;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: take measures to limit the spread of radioactive contamination from the sealed source or shielding; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: immediately after complying with paragraphs (a) to (c), notify the Commission that the leakage has been detected.

Subsection.Text: Every licensee who transfers a radiation device shall provide the transferee with the instructions referred to in the radiation device certificate for dealing with accidents, including fires and spills.
A licensee who transfers a sealed source or a nuclear substance as shielding shall provide the transferee with a record of the most recent leak test conducted in accordance with section 18.

Section.Text: No person shall use, for the purpose of the Act, the regulations made under the Act or an order or a licence, a radiation survey meter that has not been calibrated within the 12 months preceding its use.

Where a radiation device is involved in an accident or is subjected to conditions other than those in which it is designed to operate, the licensee shall discontinue using it until the licensee performs a test or an inspection which establishes that it is functioning properly.

No person shall use a radiation device in field operations unless the device has securely attached to it a durable, readily visible and legible label that sets out the name or job title and the telephone number of a person who can initiate the accident procedure referred to in the licence that has been issued in respect of the device and who can be contacted 24 hours a day.
Every licensee who is required under section 21 of the Radiation Protection Regulations to post a sign shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: post and keep posted, in a visible location at the place where the radioactive nuclear substance is used or stored, a durable and legible sign that indicates the name or job title and the telephone number of a person who can initiate any required emergency procedure and who can be contacted 24 hours a day; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: post and keep posted, in a visible location at every personnel access opening to any equipment fitted with a radiation device, a durable and legible sign that bears

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the radiation warning symbol set out in Schedule 3 to the Radiation Protection Regulations and the words “RAYONNEMENT — DANGER — RADIATION”, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the requirement to follow the personnel entry procedures required by the licence.

Section.Text: No person other than a certified exposure device operator, or a trainee who is acting under the direct supervision and continuous observation of a certified exposure device operator, shall operate an exposure device.

The Commission or a designated officer authorized under paragraph 37(2)(b) of the Act may certify a person as an exposure device operator after receiving an application that includes the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the person’s name and business address;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the person’s training and experience; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: evidence of the successful completion by the person of an examination recognized by the Commission.

Subsection.Text: The Commission or a designated officer authorized under paragraph 37(2)(b) of the Act shall notify a person who has applied for certification as an exposure device operator of a proposed decision not to certify the person, as well as the basis for the proposed decision, at least 30 days before refusing to certify the person.
The notice shall include a description of the person’s right to be provided with an opportunity to be heard in accordance with the procedure referred to in section 28.

The Commission or a designated officer authorized under paragraph 37(2)(b) of the Act shall notify a certified exposure device operator of a proposed decision to decertify the operator, as well as the basis for the proposed decision, at least 30 days before decertifying that operator.
The notice shall include a description of the certified exposure device operator’s right to be provided with an opportunity to be heard in accordance with the procedure referred to in section 28.

Where a person referred to in section 26 or a certified exposure device operator referred to in section 27 has received a notice and has requested, within 30 days after the date of receipt of the notice, an opportunity to be heard either orally or in writing, the person or the operator shall be provided with such an opportunity in accordance with the request.

On completion of a hearing held in accordance with subsection (1), the person or the certified exposure device operator who requested an opportunity to be heard shall be notified of the decision and the reasons for it.

Where neither a person referred to in section 26 nor a certified exposure device operator referred to in section 27 requests an opportunity to be heard within the period referred to in subsection (1), they shall be notified of the decision and the reasons for it.

Section.Text: A certified exposure device operator, on being notified of a decision to decertify in accordance with subsection 28(2) or (3), shall immediately surrender to the Commission the certificate that was issued to the operator.

Subsection.Text: Every licensee who possesses, uses or produces an exposure device shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: ensure that there is affixed securely to the exposure device, by means of metal fasteners, a durable steel or brass tag that is readily visible and legibly inscribed with the name, quantity in becquerels, date of measurement of that quantity and form of the nuclear substance contained in the exposure device;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: lock the exposure device and keep it locked when it is not being used; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: return a dosimeter referred to in paragraph (3)(c) to the dosimetry service that issued the dosimeter, within 10 days after the end of the period referred to in subsection 31(2).

Subsection.Text: Every licensee who becomes aware of any of the following situations shall notify the Commission immediately of the location and circumstances of the situation and of any action that the licensee has taken or proposes to take with respect to it:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the exposure device or the sealed source assembly is lost, stolen or damaged to an extent that could impair its normal use;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the exposure device has a radiation dose rate of more than 2 mSv per hour on any part of its surface when the sealed source assembly is in the shielded position;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the sealed source assembly is separated from the exposure device when the latter is not being serviced; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the sealed source assembly fails to return to the shielded position inside the exposure device.

Subsection.Text: Every licensee who authorizes a person to operate an exposure device shall provide the person with

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a radiation survey meter that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is capable of measuring a dose rate of gamma radiation from the sealed source of between 20 µSv and 100 mSv per hour, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: indicates that the power level of its batteries is sufficient for its operation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: if an external sealed source assembly guide tube is to be used,

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: material that can be used to attenuate, by a factor of at least 100, the radiation from the sealed source,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: tools that can sever from the exposure device the tube and cable to which the sealed source assembly is attached, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: tongs with a shaft at least 1.5 m long that can handle the sealed source assembly;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a dosimeter that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: has been issued by a licensed dosimetry service,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: has not been used by another person since its last reading, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: is designed so that it can be worn on the trunk of the body;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a dosimeter that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: has direct-reading display capability,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is of a type suitable for recording any dose of radiation that the person is likely to receive as a result of the operation of the exposure device,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: has been calibrated or had its calibration verified, within the 12-month period prior to being provided, to an accuracy within 20 per cent of the true dose of radiation, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: is designed so that it can be worn on the trunk of the body;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a dosimeter that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is of a type suitable for recording any dose of radiation that the person is likely to receive as a result of the operation of the exposure device,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: emits an audible warning signal when the radiation dose rate reaches or exceeds 5 mSv per hour or when the total dose of radiation reaches or exceeds 2 mSv, or emits an audible warning signal that increases proportionally to the radiation dose rate,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: is designed to prevent an unintentional change in the radiation dose rate or total dose of radiation at which the dosimeter will emit an audible warning signal,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: has been calibrated or had its calibration verified, within the 12-month period prior to being provided, to an accuracy within 20 per cent of the true dose of radiation, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: is designed so that it can be worn on the trunk of the body;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a sufficient number of durable and legible signs that bear the radiation warning symbol set out in Schedule 3 to the Radiation Protection Regulations and the words “RAYONNEMENT — DANGER — RADIATION” to enable the person to comply with paragraph 31(1)(k); and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: a sufficient number of forms to enable the person to keep the records referred to in paragraph 31(1)(e) and section 37.

Subsection.Text: No licensee shall authorize a person to operate an exposure device that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: does not appear to be functioning normally; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a radiation dose rate of more than 2 mSv per hour on any part of its surface.

Subsection.Text: Every licensee who authorizes a person to remove a sealed source from or insert a sealed source into an exposure device shall provide the person with a written authorization signed by the licensee.

Every licensee shall limit the dose of radiation received by a person, other than a nuclear energy worker, as a result of the possession or use of an exposure device to 0.1 mSv per week and 0.5 mSv per year.

No licensee shall authorize any person to respond to any of the following situations unless the person has received specialized training in the safety, regulatory and technical requirements for dealing with those situations or has received training in the safety, regulatory and technical requirements for dealing with those situations and is acting under the guidance of a person who has received the specialized training:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the exposure device or the sealed source assembly is damaged to an extent that could impair its normal use;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the exposure device has a radiation dose rate of more than 2 mSv per hour on any part of its surface when the sealed source assembly is in the shielded position;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the sealed source assembly is separated from the exposure device when the latter is not being serviced; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the sealed source assembly fails to return to the shielded position inside the exposure device.

Subsection.Text: Every person who operates an exposure device shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: use a radiation survey meter that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is capable of measuring a dose rate of gamma radiation from the sealed source of between 20 µSv and 100 mSv per hour, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: indicates that the power level of its batteries is sufficient for its operation;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: when an external sealed source assembly guide tube is being used, have immediately available the following items:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: material that can be used to attenuate, by a factor of at least 100, the radiation from the sealed source,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: tools that can sever from the exposure device the tube and cable to which the sealed source assembly is attached, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: tongs with a shaft at least 1.5 m long that can handle the sealed source assembly;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: wear on the trunk of the body a dosimeter that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: has been issued by a licensed dosimetry service, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: has not been used by another person since its last reading;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: wear on the trunk of the body a dosimeter that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: has direct-reading display capability,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: is of a type suitable for recording any dose of radiation that the person is likely to receive as a result of the operation of the exposure device, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: has been calibrated or had its calibration verified within the 12-month period prior to wearing, to an accuracy within 20 per cent of the true dose of radiation;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: keep a record of the dose of radiation received by the person for each day the person operates the exposure device, as indicated by the dosimeter referred to in paragraph (d);

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: wear on the trunk of the body a dosimeter that

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: is of a type suitable for recording any dose of radiation that the person is likely to receive as a result of the operation of the exposure device,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: emits an audible warning signal when the radiation dose rate reaches or exceeds 5 mSv per hour or when the total dose of radiation reaches or exceeds 2 mSv, or emits an audible warning signal that increases proportionally to the radiation dose rate,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: is designed to prevent an unintentional change in the radiation dose rate or total dose of radiation at which the dosimeter will emit an audible warning signal, and

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: has been calibrated or had its calibration verified within the 12-month period prior to wearing, to an accuracy within 20 per cent of the true dose of radiation;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: examine the sealed source assembly coupling and guide tube, the locking mechanism, the cranking device, the drive cable and the pneumatic pump of the exposure device immediately before operating the device to ensure that the device is functioning within the manufacturer’s specifications;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: after each attempt to move the sealed source assembly to the shielded position inside the exposure device, use a radiation survey meter to determine that the sealed source assembly is in the shielded position;

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: limit the dose of radiation received by any person, other than a nuclear energy worker, as a result of the possession or use of the exposure device to 0.1 mSv per week and 0.5 mSv per year;

Paragraph.Label: (j)
Paragraph.Text: place persons or erect barriers to prevent entry into any area within which the radiation dose rate is greater than 0.1 mSv per hour as a result of the possession or use of the exposure device;

Paragraph.Label: (k)
Paragraph.Text: post a sufficient number of durable and legible signs that bear the radiation warning symbol set out in Schedule 3 to the Radiation Protection Regulations and the words “RAYONNEMENT — DANGER — RADIATION”, to prevent entry into any area within which the radiation dose rate is greater than 0.1 mSv per hour as a result of the possession or use of the exposure device;

Paragraph.Label: (l)
Paragraph.Text: lock the exposure device when it is not being operated; and

Paragraph.Label: (m)
Paragraph.Text: where the person becomes aware of any of the following situations, immediately report to the licensee the location and circumstances of the situation and any action that the person has taken or proposes to take with respect to it:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the exposure device or the sealed source assembly is lost, stolen or damaged to an extent that could impair its normal use,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the exposure device has a radiation dose rate of more than 2 mSv per hour on any part of its surface when the sealed source assembly is in the shielded position,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the sealed source assembly is separated from the exposure device when the latter is not being serviced, or

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: a failure to return the sealed source assembly to the shielded position inside the exposure device.

Subsection.Text: Every person who has been provided with a dosimeter referred to in paragraph 30(3)(c) by a licensee shall return the dosimeter to the licensee at the end of the 15-day period beginning on the first day that the person wore the dosimeter.

Every person who keeps a record referred to in paragraph (1)(e) shall submit the record to the licensee at the end of each 15-day period, the first of which begins on the first day that the person operated the exposure device.
No person shall operate an exposure device that

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: does not appear to be functioning normally; or

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: has a radiation dose rate of more than 2 mSv per hour on any part of its surface.

Subsection.Text: Every person operating an exposure device shall, during each work shift, ensure that the dose of radiation accumulated does not exceed 2 mSv, and if the dose exceeds 2 mSv, the person shall stop work immediately and notify the licensee at the earliest opportunity.

No person shall respond to any of the following situations unless the person has received specialized training in the safety, regulatory and technical requirements for dealing with those situations or has received training in the safety, regulatory and technical requirements for dealing with those situations and is acting under the guidance of a person who has received the specialized training:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the exposure device or the sealed source assembly is damaged to an extent that could impair its normal use;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the exposure device has a radiation dose rate of more than 2 mSv per hour on any part of its surface when the sealed source assembly is in the shielded position;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the sealed source assembly is separated from the exposure device when the latter is not being serviced; or

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the sealed source assembly fails to return to the shielded position inside the exposure device.

Subsection.Text: A licensee may appoint a certified exposure device operator to supervise a trainee in the operation of an exposure device, if

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the certified exposure device operator has the qualifications, training and experience necessary to supervise a trainee in the safe operation of the exposure device;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licensee requests the certified exposure device operator, in accordance with subsection (2), to accept the appointment; and

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the certified exposure device operator accepts the appointment in writing.

Subsection.Text: A request referred to in paragraph (1)(b) shall be made in writing and shall

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: state the name of the trainee;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: state the brand name and model number of the exposure device;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: direct the attention of the certified exposure device operator to this section and to section 33; and

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: include a copy of the licence to use the exposure device.

Subsection.Text: No certified exposure device operator who is supervising a trainee in the operation of an exposure device shall permit the trainee to operate the device unless the trainee has sufficient knowledge to safely operate it.

Every certified exposure device operator who is supervising a trainee in the operation of an exposure device shall directly supervise and continuously observe the trainee while the trainee is operating the device.

Every person who removes a sealed source from or inserts a sealed source into an exposure device shall possess a written authorization to do so, signed by the licensee who possesses, uses, produces or services the exposure device.
Immediately after a person removes a sealed source from or inserts a sealed source into an exposure device, the person shall measure

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the radiation dose rate on each accessible surface of the exposure device; and

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the dose of radiation received by persons who were exposed to radiation during the removal or insertion, using a dosimeter referred to in paragraph 30(3)(d).

Subsection.Text: Every person who removes a sealed source from or inserts a sealed source into an exposure device shall record the radiation dose rates and doses of radiation referred to in subsection (2) and report them to the licensee who possesses or uses the exposure device.

Every licensee who uses more than 2 GBq of a nuclear substance that is not a sealed source for the purpose of conducting a tracer or subsurface tracer study shall notify the Commission before conducting the study.

Every licensee shall, within 60 days after using a nuclear substance referred to in subsection (1) for the purpose of conducting a tracer or subsurface tracer study, file with the Commission a report that includes

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the date and location of the study;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the name, quantity in becquerels and form of the nuclear substance used in the study;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the name of the person for whom the study was conducted;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the names of all workers who handled the nuclear substance and the dosimeter readings and bioassay results for those workers;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a description of any unusual occurrence;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the disposition of any unused nuclear substance; and

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: the specific activity of the nuclear substance upon entering and leaving the system studied and a description of the disposition of the nuclear substance.

Heading.TitleText: Records to Be Kept and Retained

Subsection.Text: Every licensee shall keep the following records:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a record of the following information in respect of any nuclear substance in the licensee’s possession that is referred to in the licence:

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the name, quantity, form and location of the nuclear substance,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: where the nuclear substance is a sealed source, the model and serial number of the source,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: where the nuclear substance is contained in a radiation device, the model and serial number of the device,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the quantity of the nuclear substance used, and

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: the manner in which the nuclear substance was used;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: a record of the name of each worker who uses or handles a nuclear substance;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: a record of any transfer, receipt, disposal or abandonment of a nuclear substance, including

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: the date of the transfer, receipt, disposal or abandonment,

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: the name and address of the supplier or the recipient,

Subparagraph.Label: (iii)
Subparagraph.Text: the number of the licence of the recipient,

Subparagraph.Label: (iv)
Subparagraph.Text: the name, quantity and form of the nuclear substance transferred, received, disposed of or abandoned,

Subparagraph.Label: (v)
Subparagraph.Text: where the nuclear substance is a sealed source, the model and serial number of the source, and

Subparagraph.Label: (vi)
Subparagraph.Text: where the nuclear substance is contained in a radiation device, the model and serial number of the device;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: a record of the training received by each worker; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a record of every inspection, measurement, test or servicing performed by the licensee in accordance with the Act, the regulations made under the Act or the licence in respect of any radiation device containing a nuclear substance that the licensee is authorized by the licence to possess.

Subsection.Text: Every licensee who holds a licence to service radiation devices shall keep a record of the following information in respect of each servicing performed on any radiation device containing a nuclear substance that another licensee, by their licence, is authorized to possess, including:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the name and address of the client for whom the servicing was performed;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the licence number of the client for whom the servicing was performed;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the brand name, model number and serial number of the radiation device;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the name, quantity and date of measurement of the nuclear substance contained in the radiation device; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: a summary of the work and the date on which the servicing was performed.

Subsection.Text: Every licensee shall retain a record referred to in paragraph (1)(d) for the period ending three years after the termination of employment of the worker.

Every person who is required to keep a record referred to in paragraph (1)(e) or subsection (1.1) shall retain the record for the period ending three years after the earlier of the expiry date and the date of revocation, if any, of the licence.

Every licensee shall keep a record of each leak test conducted on a sealed source or on shielding in accordance with section 18 and that person shall retain the record for the period ending three years after the date on which it is conducted.

Section.Text: Every licensee who possesses an exposure device shall keep a record of the following information in respect of the device:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the brand name, model number and serial number of the exposure device;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the quantity in becquerels of any nuclear substance contained in the exposure device;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the dates on which and the locations where the exposure device is operated;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date of acquisition and, where applicable, the date of disposal of the exposure device and any sealed source assembly;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the names of all persons whom the licensee has authorized to possess or use the exposure device or any sealed source assembly;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: all written authorizations provided by the licensee in accordance with subsection 30(5);

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: all requests made by the licensee in accordance with paragraph 32(1)(b) and all appointments accepted in response to those requests;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: every inspection, measurement, test, servicing or calibration performed in accordance with these Regulations; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the measurements submitted to the licensee in accordance with these Regulations by a person who has operated the exposure device.

Heading.TitleText: Reports to Be Made by Licensees

Subsection.Text: Every licensee who possesses or uses a nuclear substance or a radiation device and becomes aware of any of the following situations shall notify the Commission immediately of the location and circumstances of the situation and of any action that the licensee has taken or proposes to take with respect to it:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: the nuclear substance or the radiation device is lost or stolen;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the radiation device is damaged to an extent that could impair its normal use;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the sealed source is separated from the radiation device when the latter is not being serviced;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the sealed source fails to return to the shielded position inside the radiation device; and

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: there is a spill of

Subparagraph.Label: (i)
Subparagraph.Text: an unsealed radioactive nuclear substance that is set out in column 1 of Schedule 1, that has produced in excess of 100 times the activity set out in column 3, and

Subparagraph.Label: (ii)
Subparagraph.Text: an unsealed radioactive nuclear substance that is not set out in column 1.

Subsection.Text: Every licensee referred to in subsection (1) or subsection 30(2) who becomes aware of a situation referred to in one of those subsections shall file a full report of the situation with the Commission within 21 days after the day on which the licensee becomes aware of it or within the period specified in the licence, and the report shall contain the following information:

Paragraph.Label: (a)
Paragraph.Text: a description of the situation, the circumstances and the problem, if any, with the radiation device;

Paragraph.Label: (b)
Paragraph.Text: the probable cause of the situation;

Paragraph.Label: (c)
Paragraph.Text: the nuclear substance, and if applicable, the brand name, model number and serial number of the radiation device involved;

Paragraph.Label: (d)
Paragraph.Text: the date, time and location where the situation occurred or, if unknown, the approximate date, time and location, and the date and time of becoming aware of the situation;

Paragraph.Label: (e)
Paragraph.Text: the actions that the licensee has taken to re-establish normal operations;

Paragraph.Label: (f)
Paragraph.Text: the actions that the licensee has taken or proposes to take to prevent a recurrence of the situation;

Paragraph.Label: (g)
Paragraph.Text: if the situation involved an exposure device, the qualifications of the workers, including any trainee, who were involved;

Paragraph.Label: (h)
Paragraph.Text: the effective dose and equivalent dose — as those terms are defined in subsection 1(1) of the Radiation Protection Regulations — received by any person as a result of the situation; and

Paragraph.Label: (i)
Paragraph.Text: the effects on the environment, the health and safety of persons and the maintenance of security that have resulted or may result from the situation.

Section.Text: These Regulations come into force on the day on which they approved by the Governor in Council.

Footnote.Label: a
Footnote.Text: Parent nuclides and their progeny included in secular equilibrium are listed in the following:

Footnote.Label: a
Footnote.Text: Parent nuclides and their progeny included in secular equilibrium are listed in the following:
